paper_title.en: Existence of nonnegative solutions for quasilinear elliptic equations with indefinite critical nonlinearities

description.en:
We study the quasilinear elliptic equation
-div(phi(vertical bar del u vertical bar)del u) = a(x) f (u) + b(x) g(u) in Omega
with Dirichlet boundary condition u = 0 on partial derivative Omega, where Omega is a bounded domain in R(N), a(x), b(x) are sign-changing continuous functions, and g(u) has critical growth at infinity with respect to the principal part phi. A nonnegative, nontrivial solution is given under appropriate growth conditions on f (u), g(u) at 0 and infinity. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Quasilinear elliptic equations with slowly growing principal part and critical Orlicz-Sobolev nonlinear term

description.en: A variational problem for a functional with slowly growing principal part and involving critical Orlicz-Sobolev lower term with respect to the principal part is discussed. The principal part. of the functional is not Frechet differentiable. The lack of differentiability and the critical growth rate of the lower term demand a precise compactness argument in the variational approach. A non-negative solution for the Euler equation is given.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE ROYAL SOCIETY OF EDINBURGH SECTION A-MATHEMATICS

paper_title.en: On the existence of multiple positive solutions of quasilinear elliptic eigenvalue problems

description.en:
We study a quasilinear elliptic problem
[GRAPHICS]
with nonhomogeneous principal part phi. Under the hypothesis f(x,t)= o(phi(t)t) at t = 0 and infinity, the existence of multiple positive solutions is proved by using the variational arguments in the Orlicz-Sobolev spaces.

publication_name.en: ANNALI DI MATEMATICA PURA ED APPLICATA

paper_title.en: Positive solutions of quasilinear elliptic equations with critical orlicz-sobolev nonlinearity on R-N

description.en: A nonnegative nontrivial solution of the quasilinear elliptic differential equation (1.1) below on the entire space is obtained. The function phi(t)t in the principal part is nonhomogeneous and b(t)t has the critical Orliez-Sobolev growth with respect to phi.

paper_title.ja: Inhomogeneous elliptic equation associated with critical Sobolev exponent

paper_title.en: Inhomogeneous elliptic equation associated with critical Sobolev exponent
Multiple positive solutions of nonlinear eigenvalue problems associated to a class of p-laplacian like operators

description.en:
This paper deals with positive solutions of a class of nonlinear eigenvalue problems. For a quasilinear elliptic problem (#) - div(φ(|∇u|)∇u) = λf(x, u) in ω, u = 0 on ∂ω, we assume asymptotic conditions on φ and f such as φ(t) ∼ tp0-2, f(x, t) ∼ tq0-1 as t → + 0 and φ(t) ∼ tp1-2, f(x, t) ∼ tq1-1 as t → ∞. The combined effects of sub-nonlinearity (p0 &gt
 q0) and super-nonlinearity (p1 &lt
 q1) with the subcritical term f(x, u) imply the existence of at least two positive solutions of (#) for 0 &lt
 λ &lt
 Λ.

paper_title.ja: Multiple positive solutions of nonlinear eigenvalue problems associated to a class of p-Laplacian like operators

paper_title.en: Bifurcation phenomena associated to a class of p-Laplacian like operators

description.en: Global bifurcation of positive solutions for some degenerate quasilinear elliptic problems is considered. The uniform estimate of the gradient of weak solutions is given. This estimate is crucial in our arguments.

paper_title.en: Bifurcation phenomena associated to a class of p-Laplacian like operators

description.en: Global bifurcation of positive solutions for some degenerate quasilinear elliptic problems is considered. The uniform estimate of the gradient of weak solutions is given. This estimate is crucial in our arguments.

paper_title.en: Global bifurcation of a class of p-Laplacian like operators
Global bifurcation of a class of p-Laplacian like operators

description.en: The investigation of global bifurcation of a class of p-Laplacian like operators was presented. In the first half, global behaviour of branches of positive solutions bifurcating from first eigen values of Laplace operators was performed. In the second half, bifurcation problem of nontrival solutions from higher values of Laplace operators was performed. The uniform estimate of the gradient of solutions played a crucial part in applying the method.
